revisions.rev:
{{Other persons|Elizabeth Ryan}} {{Infobox writer <!-- for more information see [[:Template:Infobox writer/doc]] --> | image = | imagesize = 150 px | name = Gig Elizabeth Ryan | caption = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1956|11|5|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Melbourne]], [[Victoria, Australia|Victoria]], [[Australia]] | death_date = | death_place = | occupation = | genre = | movement = | notable works = | influences = | influenced = | website = }} '''Gig Ryan''', born Elizabeth Anna Martina Ryan, 5 November 1956, is an [[Australian]] [[poet]], and daughter of notable Australian surgeon [[Peter John Ryan]]
Ryan was born in [[Melbourne]], [[Australia]],{{Clarify| reason=http://www.poetrylibrary.edu.au/poets/ryan-gig says Leicester, England| date=October 2011}} and is currently the poetry editor for ''[[The Age]]'' newspaper. She has published several volumes of poetry and performed and recorded with the groups Disband and, currently, Driving Past. Her book ''Pure and Applied'' won the 1999 [[C. J. Dennis Prize for Poetry]] and her latest, ''Heroic Money'', was shortlisted for the 2002 [[Kenneth Slessor Prize for Poetry]].
==Bibliography== * ''The Division of Anger'' (1981) * ''Manners of an Astronaut'' (1984) * ''The Last Interior'' (1986) * ''Excavation'' (1990) * ''Pure and Applied'' (1998) * ''Heroic Money'' (2001)
==External links == * [http://www.austlit.com/a/ryan-gig/doa.html The Division of Anger] online at Australian Literary Resources{{Dead link|date=October 2011}} * [http://damau.org/index.php?option=com_content&task=view&id=184&Itemid=10170 Poems] and [[Vietnamese language|Vietnamese]] translations * [http://jacketmagazine.com/04/ryan-gig-3poems.html Three poems] at [[Jacket (magazine)|Jacket Magazine]] * [http://jacketmagazine.com/14/ryan-gig.html Two poems] at Jacket Magazine * [http://slope.org/archive/nine/ryan.html Dignitaries] poem at Slope Magazine * [http://www.virtual.net.au/~awithy/past.htm Driving Past] Band homepage
